description:
Lost Horse Mine  Loop - is a desert hike in Joshua Tree National Park. Some varied scenery, including a old gold mine site and very unusual vegetation.
It's desert, there is no water so take plenty with you, a gallon is suggested. 
It's extremely hot in summer but in winter it can freeze and snow (rare) at this elevation.  There is a fee for entry into Joshua Tree National park
http://www.nps.gov/jotr/planyourvisit/loader.cfm?csModule=security/getfile&PageID=295968
park map
http://www.nps.gov/pwr/customcf/apps/maps/showmap.cfm?alphacode=jotr&parkname=Joshua%20Tree%20National%20Park
directions: Park Visitor Center is in Twenty Nine Palms, turn south on Park Blvd from the light in Twentynine Palms on Highway 62.
title: Lost Horse Loop
